byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and CORAL DAVENPORT

abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi, during visit to Washington, announces intention to formally join Paris climate change agreement by end of 2016 and to set aside decades of strained relations and strengthen ties with United States; also agrees to deal under which India will buy six nuclear reactors by June 2017; move is seen as bid to capitalize on last days of Obama presidency, as Donald Trump, if elected president, might not share Pres Obama's enthusiasm for India.
lead_paragraph: Pacts on Tuesday included a crucial step to ratify the Paris climate accord and finishing the purchase of nuclear reactors, with a military deal to come.

headline.main: Narendra Modi Bolsters India’s Ties With U.S., Thanks (Partly) to Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Modi Bolsters India’s Ties to U.S., Thanks (Partly) to Trump

snippet: Pacts on Tuesday included a crucial step to ratify the Paris climate accord and finishing the purchase of nuclear reactors, with a military deal to come.
